intro: Sorbus macallisteri, commonly known as the Macallister's whitebeam, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the highlands of Scotland and is characterized by its small, white flowers and distinctive, rounded leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
